availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh F. Finley (Whitley County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Whitley County, Kentucky, attorney. Tennessee native. Son of Robert Finley and Ann Finley. Married to Jennie Renfro Moss Finley. Father of Frank Wolford Finley and Charles Finley. Attorney in Williamsburg, Kentucky, in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives from Whitley County from 1861 to 1862. Commonwealth's attorney for the 12th Judicial District of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1862 to 1866.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Whitley County, District No. 2, p. 419B; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Whitley County, Williamsburg, p. 76; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1878), p. 758; Find A Grave, "Hugh Franklin Finley (1833-1909)," Memorial #7781672, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=7781672&ref=acom (accessed July 27, 2017); KYR-0001-029-0507.
